text: William Bridges "Will" Hunter (February 19, 1883 – August 25, 1966) was an American track and field athlete who competed in the 1904 Summer Olympics. He competed in the 60 metres. He did not make it out of the heats, finishing outside the top two and so failing to qualify automatically or for the repechage. == See also == * United States at the 1904 Summer Olympics == References == * Category:1883 births Category:1966 deaths Category:American male sprinters Category:Olympic track and field athletes of the United States Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1904 Summer Olympics
title: William Hunter (American athlete)
